project.description: -> Transfer an already OPENCAPI built image to the right card and test it for Questions: please contact A.Castellane or F.Moyen

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for https://github.com/OpenCAPI/oc-accel you want to test. Please do not use wildcards!!

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: OCUTILS_URL
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: URL for oc-utils github project (you may change this only if you want to test a specific fork repository)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: OCUTILS_BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for $OCUTILS_URL (typically https://github.com/OpenCAPI/oc-utils) you want to test. Please do not use wildcards!!

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: mopBoxes
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of Montpellier systems available for testing Orpington and Lewen05 are P9

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: austinBoxes
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of Austin systems available for testing : (Assuming no VPN or jump server is needed to access Austin servers, 9.X.X.X addresses) (it needs to define capimop user with authorized_keys)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: CARDS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of available cards for Hardware test CARDS=(OC-AD9V3 OC-AD9H3 OC-AD9H7)

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Allows default cleaning the directory at the end

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CHECKUSER
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Check if users are connected at working hours

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: USE_OC_UTILS_CHECKOUT
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: To allow usage of a previous level of oc-utils

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: FLASH
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description:
Flashing the card is the default
If unselected we just run the test on existing action already programmed in the requested card The card is selected based on the provided file name. Eg: OC-AD9H3xxxxx.bin provided => an OC-AD9H3 card will be tested

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
set +x # reduce Jenkins output ulimit -c unlimited # limit core dumps
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Variables
TESTBOXES=( ${mopBoxes[*]} ${austinBoxes[*]} ) # init array of systems CARDSList=($CARDS) EmailDestinationList=( fabrice_moyen@fr.ibm.com ) HWUser="capimop"
mopIMGRootDir="/data/Images" IMGFileName=$(basename $mopIMGFile) mopIMGDir=$(dirname $mopIMGRootDir/$mopIMGFile) IMGServers="jtagx86" # List of servers where to push generated images.
ExecutorIMGRootDir="/home/$HWUser/images/single_test"
SudoOrNotSudo="sudo" # ="sudo" or "" if sudo not needed to access /dev/ocxl
HWUser="capimop"
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "JENKINS:" echo " Testing Binary : $mopIMGDir/$IMGFileName" echo echo " testboxes now : ${TESTBOXES[@]}" echo " Cards list : ${CARDSList[*]}" echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "***************************************************************************************"; echo
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Functions
function die { # define function to exit with msg: call with "die [exit_RC] [msg]" local RC=$1 shift; local message="$@"; [ -z "$message" ] && message="Died" echo "$message at ${BASH_SOURCE[1]}:${FUNCNAME[1]} line ${BASH_LINENO[0]}." >&2 exit 1 }
function finish { # define function to unlock in case of error, executed after registering with "trap finish EXIT" echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: FINISH function"
echo "RC=$?" echo;echo " -> unlocking ${LOCK}" UNLOCK_RC=0;ssh ${HWUser}@${box} rmdir ${LOCK} || UNLOCK_RC=$? echo "box=$box lock=$LOCK unlock RC=$UNLOCK_RC (`date`)"
if [ "$CLEAN" == "false" ]; then echo;echo " -> NO CLEANING REQUESTED !"; echo;echo " -> EXITING !"; else echo;echo " -> cleaning ${box}@$TARGET_DIR"; CLEAN_RC=0;ssh -T ${HWUser}@$box rm -rf ${TARGET_DIR} || CLEAN_RC=$?; echo "box=$box clean target_dir=$TARGET_DIR RC=$CLEAN_RC (`date`)"; echo;echo " -> EXITING !"; fi
}
# Function for sending alerting emails # Example 1: SendAnEmail -s "This is the subject/alert" -d firstDest@gmail.com -d SecondDest@free.fr # Example 2: SendAnEmail -s "This is the subject/alert" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}" function SendAnEmail { local OPTIND opt DestList while getopts "s:d:" opt do case $opt in s) Subject="$OPTARG" ;; d) DestList+=("$OPTARG") ;; esac done
for i in ${DestList[@]} do echo "" | mail -s "$Subject" $i done }
# Function to move BINFILES and BITFILES to the right directory # Example 1: MoveToDir -c $CRD -b "$BINFILES" -B "$BITFILES" -d $SaveDir -s jtagx86 -u $HWUser # Example 2: MoveToDir -c $CRD -b "$BINFILES" -B "$BITFILES" -d $SaveDir -s "jtagx86 orpington" -u $HWUser # Example 3: MoveToDir -c $CRD -b "$BINFILES" -B "$BITFILES" -d $SaveDir -s "$IMGServers" -u $HWUser # -b & -B (maybe not -B) should use "" as $BINFILES & $BITFILES are usually lists of files like "primary.bin secondary.bin"
function MoveToDir { local OPTIND opt FPGACard Bin Bit ToDir SSHDest SSHUser while getopts "c:b:B:d:s:u:" opt do case $opt in b) Bin="$OPTARG" ;; B) Bit="$OPTARG" ;; d) ToDir="$OPTARG" ;; c) FPGACard="$OPTARG" ;; s) SSHDest="$OPTARG" ;; u) SSHUser="$OPTARG" ;; esac done
echo "";echo "+ Moving $FPGACard bin-file(s) & bit-file(s) images to $ToDir" mkdir -p $ToDir chmod g+w $ToDir mv $Bin $ToDir echo $ToDir/`basename $Bin` if [ "$Bit" != "" ]; then mv $Bit $ToDir; echo $ToDir/`basename $Bit`; fi
for i in $SSHDest do echo;echo "+ Moving $FPGACard bin-file(s) & bit-file(s) images to $i:$ToDir" ssh ${SSHUser}@$i "mkdir -p $ToDir; chmod g+w $ToDir; mv $Bin $ToDir; echo $ToDir/`basename $Bin`" if [ "$Bit" != "" ]; then ssh ${SSHUser}@$i "mv $Bit $ToDir"; echo $ToDir/`basename $Bit`; fi done }
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Test if file size is coherent
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Testing if file size is coherent ($mopIMGDir/$IMGFileName)..." size=`wc -c < "$mopIMGDir/$IMGFileName"` echo " -> Size of file is $size" (( $size < 100000 )) && die 1 " -> Image $$mopIMGDir/$IMGFileName is too small $size to burn"
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Create a list of Cards sorted by card names' length # This allows to search for N250SP card before N250S card for example # and prevents finding an N250S card when it is an N250SP in the Image file name
SortedCARDSString=$(for card in "${CARDSList[@]}";do echo $card | awk '{print length,$0}' done | sort --reverse | cut -d' ' -f2- )
SortedCARDSList=($SortedCARDSString)
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Search for a card in the Image file name
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Searching for the card name in the image file name ($IMGFileName)..."
for CRD in "${SortedCARDSList[@]}";do if [[ "$IMGFileName" =~ "$CRD" ]];then echo " -> Found card=$CRD for image=$IMGFileName size=$size";break;fi # ici il faut tester si on "oc" en debut de fichier ET Ã partir de Oc-CARD si on a CARD # if [[ "$IMGFileName" =~ "oc" ]];then echo " -> Found card=$CRD for image=$IMGFileName size=$size";break;fi if [ $CRD == ${SortedCARDSList[*]: -1} ];then die 100 " -> Cannot find card for image=$IMGFileName in cards=${CARDSList[*]}";fi done
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # SPI8 Cards case: meaning primary and secondary IMG files
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Checking if $CRD card is SPI8..."
if echo $IMGFileName | egrep "primary|secondary" ; then echo " -> SPI8 file detected";SPI8=1; else echo " -> Not an SPI8 file";SPI8=0; fi
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Generating ReducedFileName (without _primary.bin or _secondary.bin)
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Reducing Image name to get the base name"
ReducedFileName="${IMGFileName%_*}" # Get all the beginning up to the last "_" (removing "_primary.bin" or "_secondary.bin") IMGBitName="$(echo ${ReducedFileName}| sed 's/ //g').bit"
if [ "$SPI8" -eq "1" ];then echo " SPI8 => Memorizing the primary and secondary image names" ReducedFileName="${IMGFileName%_*}" # Get all the beginning up to the last "_" (removing "_primary.bin" or "_secondary.bin") echo $ReducedFileName IMGPrimaryName="$(echo ${ReducedFileName}| sed 's/ //g')_primary.bin" # need to remove blank in prefix IMGSecondaryName="$(echo ${ReducedFileName}| sed 's/ //g')_secondary.bin" IMGBitName="$(echo ${ReducedFileName}| sed 's/ //g').bit" echo "CARD detected is : $CRD" echo "Primary file is : $IMGPrimaryName" echo "Secondary file is : $IMGSecondaryName" echo "Bit file (if exists) is : $IMGBitName"
else ReducedFileName="${IMGFileName%.bin}" # Get all the beginning up to the .bin echo $ReducedFileName; IMGBitName="$(echo ${ReducedFileName}| sed 's/ //g').bit" fi
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Test if boxes in TESTBOXES are accessible
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Testing POWER servers accessibility:"
for box in "${TESTBOXES[@]}";do
if [[ ${mopBoxes[*]} =~ $box ]] then # $box is a Montpellier server echo -e "MOP : $box -> \c" RC=0;ssh ${HWUser}@$box ping localhost -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 || RC=$? else echo -e "AUSTIN: $box -> \c" RC=0;ssh ${HWUser}@$box ping localhost -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 || RC=$? fi
if [ $RC == "0" ]; then echo "OK" else echo "FAILED" for i in "${TESTBOXES[@]}"; do [[ $i != $box ]] && new+=($i);done # generate new test array without unreachable box unset TESTBOXES;TESTBOXES=("${new[@]}");unset new # reassign to original array name echo "$box not reachable => removed from Boxes testing list, remaining=${TESTBOXES[@]}" if [[ "${TESTBOXES[@]}" == "" ]];then echo "no test machines avail anymore";exit 1;fi fi
done
echo;echo "testboxes now : ${TESTBOXES[@]}"
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Waiting for available $CRD in ${TESTBOXES[*]}
maxloop=60 echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Searching (max $maxloop min) for free card=$CRD into ( ${TESTBOXES[@]} ) (`date`)"
FindCardTool="oc_find_card"
for loop in `seq 1 $maxloop`;do
echo;echo "*************************************************" echo "J: LOOP $loop/$maxloop (`date`)"
for box in "${TESTBOXES[@]}";do
echo;echo "-------------------------------------------------" echo "$box"
# AC: Dirty invalidating user check
if [ "$CHECKUSER" == "true" ]; then nusers=`ssh ${HWUser}@${box} who|grep -v root|grep -v ${HWUser}|wc -l` else nusers=0 fi
# nusers=`ssh ${HWUser}@${box} who|grep -v root|grep -v ${HWUser}|wc -l`
find_card=$FindCardTool.${GIT_COMMIT}.`date +%H%M%S`
echo " --> Copying the tool $FindCardTool ($find_card) to $box:/home/${HWUser}" RC=0;scp oc-accel/software/tools/$FindCardTool ${HWUser}@$box:/home/${HWUser}/$find_card ; RC=$? if [ $RC -gt 0 ];then echo " -> copy $find_card to $box FAILED, continuing anyway..."; fi
echo -e " --> Using specific $FindCardTool, looking for $CRD inside ${box}: \c" echo "" #echo "Oc_find_card version is :";ssh -ttq ${HWUser}@${box} /home/${HWUser}/$find_card -V > /dev/null 2>&1 # Previous line doesn't provide version, and follwing generates errors, but at least we can check the version echo "Oc_find_card version is :";ssh -ttq ${HWUser}@${box} /home/${HWUser}/$find_card -V
#found=0;ssh -ttq ${HWUser}@${box} /home/${HWUser}/$find_card -A ${CRD} > /dev/null 2>&1 ||found=$? found=0;ssh -ttq ${HWUser}@${box} /home/${HWUser}/$find_card -A ${CRD} > /dev/null 2>&1 ||found=$? # ($find_card gives the number of found cards inside $?) # we use $find_card without the -v option. Be careful that any modification of oc_find_card report affects this step # make sure oc_find_card only report the cards numbers.
if [ $found -ne 0 ];then cards=`ssh -ttq ${HWUser}@${box} "/home/${HWUser}/$find_card -A ${CRD} 2>/dev/null" | head -n1` echo -e "OK: $found CARD(S) FOUND (card-IDs= $cards)" # (head is needed because if more than 1 card, $find_card returns something like "0 0" and second line with "Total 2 cards detected") else echo "FAILED: NO CARD FOUND" unset cards fi
echo " --> Removing the tool $FindCardTool ($find_card) from $box" SSH_RC=0;ssh -ttq ${HWUser}@${box} rm /home/${HWUser}/$find_card || SSH_RC=$? if [ $SSH_RC -gt 0 ];then echo " -> Delete $find_card to $box FAILED, continuing anyway..."; fi
echo;echo "J: loop=$loop box=$box nusers=$nusers card=$CRD $FindCardTool found=$found (`date`)" echo
hours=`date +%H`
case $found:$nusers in
#------------------------------------ # no card available => try other box 0:*) for i in "${TESTBOXES[@]}"; do [[ $i != $box ]] && new+=($i);done # generate new test array without unreachable box unset TESTBOXES;TESTBOXES=("${new[@]}");unset new # reassign to original array name echo "card not avail in $box => removed from Boxes testing list, remaining=${TESTBOXES[@]}" continue # next box or next loop (if it was the last box of the list) ;;
#------------------------------------ # card available & no user => now lock & test # [1234]:0) we extend the position to the PCI equivalent position [123456789]:0) for cardid in $cards;do LOCK="jenkins_lock_card$cardid" RC=0;ssh ${HWUser}@$box "mkdir ${LOCK} 2>/dev/null"||RC=$? if [ $RC == "0" ]; then : echo " --> box=$box lock=$LOCK lock RC=$RC (`date`)"; trap finish EXIT # register finish/unlock function, after lock is set break 3 # found card and no user => going out of $box for-loop and $loop for-loop else echo " --> box=$box lock=$LOCK already locked, trying next card" fi done ;;
#------------------------------------ # found something else than 1,2,3 or 4 cards => meaning BAD $found return code *:0) echo " --> unknown found_RC=$found from $FindCardTool=$cards. EXITING..." exit 100 ;;
#------------------------------------ # card available but user(s) connected... *) if (( 9<=hours && hours<=19 ));then # It is day time => priority to interactive users echo " --> $CRD card found but day time (hours=$hours) and users connected (nusers=$nusers), trying next box / loop..." if [ $box == ${TESTBOXES[*]:(-1)} ];then echo " --> $box is the last system to test; Warning users and waiting for 60s..." ssh ${HWUser}@$box wall "JENKINS WANTS TO DO A TEST on FPGA CARD=$CRD ID=$cards. PLEASE LOGOUT IF YOU CAN ..." sleep 60 # Last box of the list TESBOXES => Waiting 60s and go to next loop fi continue # next box or next loop (if it was the last box of the list)
else # It is night => running on $box even if there are connected users ssh ${HWUser}@${box} who|grep -v root|grep -v ${HWUser} echo " --> hours=$hours (night), nusers=$nusers, now lock & notify & test" for cardid in $cards;do LOCK="jenkins_lock_card$cardid" RC=0;ssh ${HWUser}@$box "mkdir ${LOCK} 2>/dev/null"||RC=$? if [ $RC == "0" ]; then : echo " --> box=$box lock=$LOCK lock RC=$RC (`date`)"; trap finish EXIT # register finish/unlock function, after lock is set ssh ${HWUser}@$box wall "WARNING: JENKINS OPENCAPI TEST STARTING NOW on FPGA CARD=$CRD ID=$cards" break 3 # found card and it is the night => going out of $box for-loop and $loop for-loop else echo " --> box=$box lock=$LOCK already locked, try next card" fi done fi ;;
esac
done # for box
done #for loop
if [ $loop -eq $maxloop ];then echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: No card $CRD available with TESTBOXES= ${TESTBOXES[*]}" echo echo " -> EXITING !" exit 1 fi
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo " running test --> $box" | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]' echo "***************************************************************************************"
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Preparing $CRD card image(s) test onto $box system" echo ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo ------ START of JOB on $box ---->> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "date >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo JOB_NAME : $JOB_NAME >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo Card : $CRD[$cardid] >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo Image : /home/$HWUser/$IMGFileName >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo Build No : ${BUILD_NUMBER} >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo Git Branch: ${GIT_BRANCH} >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} tail -n7 jenkins.log
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Copying Working directory TARGET_DIR into $box:/home/$HWUser
TARGET_DIR="`basename $PWD`-${ReducedFileName}-${BUILD_NUMBER}" echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Copying oc-accel working directory into $box:/home/$HWUser/$TARGET_DIR" echo " (Local current Dir = $PWD)"
RUN="./actions/scripts/oc_jenkins.sh" echo " -> Creating $box:/home/$HWUser/$TARGET_DIR, if not existing" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} mkdir -p ${TARGET_DIR} echo " -> Copying oc-accel workspace directory to ${box}:/home/${HWUser}/${TARGET_DIR}" rsync -az oc-accel/ ${HWUser}@${box}:/home/${HWUser}/${TARGET_DIR}
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Copying Image(s) into $box:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Copying Image(s) into $box:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD"
echo " -> mkdir ${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD, if not existing" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} mkdir -p ${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD
if [ "FLASH" == "true" ]; then
if [ "$SPI8" -eq "1" ];then echo " -> Copying Image $IMGPrimaryName to $box:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD" rsync -aLz $mopIMGDir/$IMGPrimaryName ${HWUser}@${box}:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD echo " -> Copying Image $IMGSecondaryName to $box:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD" rsync -aLz $mopIMGDir/$IMGSecondaryName ${HWUser}@${box}:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD RUN+=" -D ${TARGET_DIR}" if [ -z ${mopIMGFile} ]; then RUN+=" -A ALL";else RUN+=" -F ${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD/$IMGPrimaryName -f ${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD/$IMGSecondaryName -A ${CRD} -C $cardid";fi
else echo " -> Copying Image $IMGFileName to $box:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD" rsync -aLz $mopIMGDir/$IMGFileName ${HWUser}@${box}:${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD RUN+=" -D ${TARGET_DIR}" if [ -z ${mopIMGFile} ]; then RUN+=" -A ALL";else RUN+=" -F ${ExecutorIMGRootDir}/$CRD/$IMGFileName -A ${CRD} -C $cardid";fi fi
else # User has requested no flashing, $CRD is previously built with provided IMG name # no need to manage files RUN+=" -D ${TARGET_DIR}"; RUN+=" -A ${CRD} -C $cardid"
fi #end of if FLASH=true
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Build the OC-ACCEL software into $TARGET_DIR on the $box
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Building the OC-ACCEL software and actions on $box in $TARGET_DIR..." ssh ${HWUser}@${box} make -C ${TARGET_DIR} clean software actions
echo "copy new $FindCardTool to homedir"; ssh ${HWUser}@${box} cp ${TARGET_DIR}/software/tools/$FindCardTool .
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Git clone capi-utils tools into $box:/home/$HWUser
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Git cloning oc-Utils tools into $box:/home/$HWUser..." echo " (oc-flash-script.sh used by command `echo $RUN | cut -d' ' -f1` )" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} rm -rf oc-utils echo "echo OCUtils URL = $OCUTILS_URL" echo "Running : ${HWUser}@${box} git clone -b $OCUTILS_BRANCH $OCUTILS_URL oc-utils" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} git clone -b $OCUTILS_BRANCH $OCUTILS_URL oc-utils
#AC: use of a previous branch if [ "$USE_OC_UTILS_CHECKOUT" == "true" ]; then ssh ${HWUser}@${box} git checkout $OC_UTILS_COMMIT fi
# FAB: linking capi-utils/psl-devices to /lib/capi-utils/psl-devices modified by Alexandre #echo " -> Linking ~/capi-utils/psl-devices to /lib/capi-utils/psl-devices modified by Alexandre" #ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "if [ -f /lib/capi-utils/psl-devices ]; then rm capi-utils/psl-devices; ln -s /lib/capi-utils/psl-devices capi-utils/psl-devices; fi"
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Build the capi-utils software into $box:/home/$HWUser/capi-utils on the $box
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Building the oc-utils software on $box in /home/$HWUser/oc-utils..."
echo " oc-utils is compiled locally to prevent over-writing the server default config (/lib/capi-utils preserved)" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} make -C /home/$HWUser/oc-utils
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Execute the $RUN command on the $box
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Executing Test: $SudoOrNotSudo ${RUN}" echo " on $box (`date`)"
RC_RUN=0 ssh -T ${HWUser}@${box} << EOF || RC_RUN=$? export TERM=xterm cd ${TARGET_DIR} set -f ulimit -c unlimited # limit core dumps $SudoOrNotSudo ${RUN} EOF
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Updating remote Power server local logs ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo Exit: $JOB_NAME RC = $RC_RUN at:\ >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "date >> jenkins.log" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "echo ------ EXIT ----------------------->> jenkins.log"
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # To Simulate IMG_TEST case, we defined a fake ACT ACT=hls_helloworld_1024 # we then create the env for this fake action
#Knowing what the ACT should be, we check if the hardware contains this action # be careful in NO_FLASH mode it will depend on existing action echo "J: Expected action is: $ACT" echo "J: searching for existing action" #ACTUAL_ACT<< ssh -T ${HWUser}@${box} << EOF || RC=$? cd ${TARGET_DIR}/; ls -al; source ./snap_path.sh; # to allow find snap_peek cd actions/$ACT/; grep -r "define ACTION_TYPE" *| awk '{print $NF}'; snap_peek -w32 0x0010| awk '{print $NF}'; EOF
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Do Clean-up work: $TARGET_DIR on the $box, and image files at MOPJENKINS site
echo;echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Checking RUN return code (`date`)..." echo
if [ $RC_RUN -eq 0 ]; then mopIMGGoodDir=${mopIMGRootDir}/${CRD}/${CRD}_test_OK #if mkdir $mopIMGGoodDir 2>/dev/null; then chmod g+w $mopIMGGoodDir; fi
echo "Job return code is good ==>"
if [ "$CLEAN" == "false" ]; then echo;echo "NO CLEAN REQUEST by USER : NOT Cleaning up working directory ${TARGET_DIR} from ${box}";
else
echo " => $box: Cleaning working directory" echo " => Jenkins: Cleaning images from $mopIMGDir" echo " => $box: Moving Primary/secondary image file to good.* inside $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD" echo " (needs to be manually done because OC-ACCEL github script does not manage Primary/Secondary files for the moment)" echo " (so it is just renaming primary to primary.good)" echo;echo "Cleaning up working directory ${TARGET_DIR} from ${box}"; ssh ${HWUser}@${box} rm -rf ${TARGET_DIR}; fi
# we don't want to manage files as we used it just to pick up the card name $CRD if [ "FLASH" == "true" ]; then
if [ "$SPI8" -eq "1" ];then echo;echo "+ Renaming primary/secondary files to good.* on ${box}" echo " -> $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/good.$IMGPrimaryName" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "mv \`ls $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/${IMGPrimaryName}*\` $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/good.$IMGPrimaryName" echo " -> $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/good.$IMGSecondaryName" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "mv \`ls $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/${IMGSecondaryName}*\` $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/good.$IMGSecondaryName"
MoveToDir -c $CRD -b "$mopIMGDir/$IMGPrimaryName $mopIMGDir/$IMGSecondaryName" -B "$mopIMGDir/$IMGBitName" -d $mopIMGGoodDir -s "$IMGServers" -u $HWUser
else echo;echo "+ Renaming binary file to good.* on ${box}" echo " -> $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/good.$IMGFileName" ssh ${HWUser}@${box} "mv \`ls $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/${IMGFileName}*\` $ExecutorIMGRootDir/$CRD/good.$IMGFileName"
MoveToDir -c $CRD -b "$mopIMGDir/$IMGFileName" -B "$mopIMGDir/$IMGBitName" -d $mopIMGGoodDir -s "$IMGServers" -u $HWUser
fi #end of if $SPI8" -eq "1"
fi #end of if FLASH=true echo
else die 100 "Job return code indicates FAILURE RC = $RC (`date`) => exit UNSTABLE" fi
